newsitem.title: USA: US spot propane drifts lower, tracking crude oil.
newsitem.headline: US spot propane drifts lower, tracking crude oil.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices were lower in late trade on Wednesday, tracking NYMEX crude oil futures driven down by news of Iraqi troop withdrawals.
Trade, however, was very quiet as many players stood on the sidelines to watch the conflict play out and to gauge market direction.
"People are just trying to ride the bumps and buying only what they need," said one Houston trader.
On the U.S. Gulf Coast, Mont Belvieu, Texas, propane shed a half cent to between 42.00 cents and 42.25 cents a gallon in thin activity.
Conway, Kansas, hub material fell a half cent to 40.50/40.75 cents, with deals done at 40.50 cents, traders said.
Prices began to drift down at midday after news of Iraqi troop withdrawals from a Kurdish community in the north. The incursion provoked U.S. missile strikes over the past two days.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859-1631
